title.narrative: Social and Behavior Change Communication Activity (Ujjiban)

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Ujjiban Social and Behavior Change Communication (SBCC) activity will generate demand for and increase the use of high-quality services for maternal, neonatal, child and adolescent health; family planning; nutrition and tuberculosis, and improve adoption of healthy behaviors in selected districts under in both Sylhet and Chattrogram divisions. At the national level, Ujjiban will strengthen the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's capacity and systems, to effectively design, develop, coordinate and implement SBCC interventions. With FY 2020 funds, Ujjiban will intensify its focus on gender and health by using diverse communication media and methods (both traditional and new) as well as community outreach programs to encourage audience members to adopt key health behaviors in the areas of maternal, neonatal and child health; family planning, tuberculosis, and nutrition. Ujjiban will also carry out campaigns to raise awareness on ending early marriage and combating gender-based violence. The activity will further explore opportunities to leverage the private sector to ensure greater coverage of Ujjiban's SBCC products. To address risk communication and community engagement on COVID-19, USAID, through the Ujjiban activity, will strengthen risk communication systems, improve public communication, support community engagement, and address misperceptions and misinformation.This activity will support the U.S. National Security Strategy Pillar IV, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved health status in Bangladesh..
